entryHall.newText: just as you turn to look about, there's a low rumbling, and the doorway through which you just entered has vanished. there is no coming back the way you came. god hope you have your ticket with you

study.name: Study
study.nextext: This Study seems strangely new. There's the embers of a fire in the fire place, and books scattered around. There's not a mote of dust in sight though.

stacksAndStacksOfBooks.name: Stacks and stacks of books
stacksAndStacksOfBooks.nextext: There's a lot of books, some are quite captivating. But we don't want to be here all day.

firePlace.name: Fireplace
firePlace.nextext: This fire place has hot coals in it, the arm chair adjacent suggest that there may have been someone here. But there's no open book or tea to speak of. The embers glow with a reassuring warmth.

ornateBookshelf.name: An Ornate Bookshelf

silverBook.inspectText: A strange cold is emanating from the book, the cover is shiny like it might be frozen over.
silverBook.useText: As you pull the book from the shelf, it slips from your grasp and lands on the floor with a thud. No sooner than it lands, the floor opens up and you plummet into the darkness below

bronzeBook.inspectText: This book is lovely, you just know it will be a page turner!.
bronzeBook.useText: It comes freely and settles in your hands comfortably. It's like this book was meant for you. You begin to read and suddenly you're ten pages deep, it's like nothing you've ever seen before! You finish the book and close it with a satisfying snap. Several hours have passed, you think. That was fun but it didn't get you anywhere, and for some odd reason you can't remember anything about the books contents. Strangely, you feel the need to open it again.

leatherboundBook.inspectText: This plain book stands out on the shelf.
leatherboundBook.useText: As you pull the book from the shelf it get's caught halfway, it's attached to some kind of lever. With a loud clunk the fireplace spins around to reveal a secret passage.

text: There's something very peculiar about this bookshelf. If only there was a movie trope that could help us here.

The shelf is filled with books from top to bottom, they are all the same book except for three. The three odd books are spaced out seemingly randomly. One that's silver, and cold to the touch. One that's bronze, and leaves you feeling queasy if you stare at it for too long. And one that's leather-bound.
You notice that every other book on this shelf is a copy of: "On the Nature of Wild Animals." it's a purple book that's rather small.
